trans-unit.source: List the jobs in an account
trans-unit.target: List the jobs in an account

trans-unit.source: List the jobs in an account
trans-unit.target: List the jobs in an account

trans-unit.source: Lists all of the jobs in the specified account.
trans-unit.target: Lists all of the jobs in the specified account.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to jobs.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="0e07b9cb-8fdf-4ff7-b707-e964200df0f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to jobs.

trans-unit.source: The value for {filter} can be the following or any AND-ed combination of the following:
trans-unit.target: The value for {filter} can be the following or any AND-ed combination of the following:

trans-unit.source: startswith, eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt
trans-unit.target: startswith, eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt

trans-unit.source: eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt
trans-unit.target: eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt

trans-unit.source: eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt
trans-unit.target: eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt

trans-unit.source: eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt
trans-unit.target: eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt

trans-unit.source: eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt
trans-unit.target: eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt

trans-unit.source: eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt
trans-unit.target: eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt

trans-unit.source: startswith, eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt
trans-unit.target: startswith, eq, ne, ge, gt, le, lt

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e9da2d54-053a-4392-a5ba-26229c7cc9a5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>

trans-unit.source: The display name of the job.
trans-unit.target: The display name of the job.

trans-unit.source: You can use it to detect whether the job has changed between requests.
trans-unit.target: You can use it to detect whether the job has changed between requests.

trans-unit.source: In particular, you can be pass the ETag with an Update Job request to specify that your changes should take effect only if nobody else has modified the job in the meantime.
trans-unit.target: In particular, you can be pass the ETag with an Update Job request to specify that your changes should take effect only if nobody else has modified the job in the meantime.

trans-unit.source: The last modified time of the job.
trans-unit.target: The last modified time of the job.

trans-unit.source: This is the last time at which the job level data, such as the job state or priority, changed.
trans-unit.target: This is the last time at which the job level data, such as the job state or priority, changed.

trans-unit.source: It does not factor in task-level changes such as adding new tasks or tasks changing state.
trans-unit.target: It does not factor in task-level changes such as adding new tasks or tasks changing state.

trans-unit.source: The creation time of the job.
trans-unit.target: The creation time of the job.

trans-unit.source: The current state of the job.
trans-unit.target: The current state of the job.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>active</languageKeyword> – the job is available to have tasks scheduled
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>active</languageKeyword> – the job is available to have tasks scheduled

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>disabling</languageKeyword> –a user has requested that the job be disabled, but the disable operation is still in progress (for example, waiting for tasks to terminate)
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>disabling</languageKeyword> –a user has requested that the job be disabled, but the disable operation is still in progress (for example, waiting for tasks to terminate)

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>disabled</languageKeyword> – a user has disabled the job.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>disabled</languageKeyword> – a user has disabled the job.

trans-unit.source: No tasks are running, and no new tasks will be scheduled.
trans-unit.target: No tasks are running, and no new tasks will be scheduled.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Disable a job.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Disable a job.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>enabling</languageKeyword> – a user has requested that the job be enabled, but the enable operation is still in progress
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>enabling</languageKeyword> – a user has requested that the job be enabled, but the enable operation is still in progress

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>terminating</languageKeyword> –the job is about to complete, either because a Job Manager task has completed or because the user has terminated the job, but the terminate operation is still in progress (for example, because Job Release tasks are running).
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>terminating</languageKeyword> –the job is about to complete, either because a Job Manager task has completed or because the user has terminated the job, but the terminate operation is still in progress (for example, because Job Release tasks are running).

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> – all tasks have terminated, and the system will not accept any more tasks or any further changes to the job.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> – all tasks have terminated, and the system will not accept any more tasks or any further changes to the job.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>deleting</languageKeyword> –a user has requested that the job be deleted, but the delete operation is still in progress (for example, because the system is still terminating running tasks).
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>deleting</languageKeyword> –a user has requested that the job be deleted, but the delete operation is still in progress (for example, because the system is still terminating running tasks).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b5333b8f-e566-4c7e-bbe9-df04b9a6970d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delete a job from an account</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b5333b8f-e566-4c7e-bbe9-df04b9a6970d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Delete a job from an account</link>.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the job entered its current state.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the job entered its current state.

trans-unit.source: The previous state of the job.
trans-unit.target: The previous state of the job.

trans-unit.source: This property is not present if the job is in its initial active state.
trans-unit.target: This property is not present if the job is in its initial active state.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the job entered its previous state.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the job entered its previous state.

trans-unit.source: This property is not present if the job is in its initial active state.
trans-unit.target: This property is not present if the job is in its initial active state.

trans-unit.source: Priority values can range from -1000 to 1000, with -1000 being the lowest priority and 1000 being the highest priority.
trans-unit.target: Priority values can range from -1000 to 1000, with -1000 being the lowest priority and 1000 being the highest priority.

trans-unit.source: The execution constraints for the job.
trans-unit.target: The execution constraints for the job.

trans-unit.source: The details of the Job Manager task, if any.
trans-unit.target: The details of the Job Manager task, if any.

trans-unit.source: The Job Manager is a special task run when the job starts.
trans-unit.target: The Job Manager is a special task run when the job starts.

trans-unit.source: This property is not present if a Job Manager is not associated with the job.
trans-unit.target: This property is not present if a Job Manager is not associated with the job.

trans-unit.source: The details of the Job Preparation task associated with the job, if any.
trans-unit.target: The details of the Job Preparation task associated with the job, if any.

trans-unit.source: The Job Preparation task is a special task run on each node before any other task of the job.
trans-unit.target: The Job Preparation task is a special task run on each node before any other task of the job.

trans-unit.source: The details of the Job Release task associated with the job, if any.
trans-unit.target: The details of the Job Release task associated with the job, if any.

trans-unit.source: The Job Release task is a special task run at the end of the job on each node that has run any other task of the job.
trans-unit.target: The Job Release task is a special task run at the end of the job on each node that has run any other task of the job.

trans-unit.source: A list of common environment variable settings for all tasks in the job.
trans-unit.target: A list of common environment variable settings for all tasks in the job.

trans-unit.source: The pool settings associated with the job.
trans-unit.target: The pool settings associated with the job.

trans-unit.source: The execution information for the job.
trans-unit.target: The execution information for the job.

trans-unit.source: A list of name-value pairs associated with the job as metadata.
trans-unit.target: A list of name-value pairs associated with the job as metadata.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service does not assign any meaning to metadata; it is solely for the use of user code.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service does not assign any meaning to metadata; it is solely for the use of user code.

trans-unit.source: Contains resource usage statistics for the entire lifetime of the job.
trans-unit.target: Contains resource usage statistics for the entire lifetime of the job.

trans-unit.source: The maximum elapsed time that the task may run, measured from the time the task starts.
trans-unit.target: The maximum elapsed time that the task may run, measured from the time the task starts.

trans-unit.source: If the task does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it.
trans-unit.target: If the task does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it.

trans-unit.source: If this is not specified, there is no time limit on how long the task may run.
trans-unit.target: If this is not specified, there is no time limit on how long the task may run.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of times the task may be retried.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of times the task may be retried.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.

trans-unit.source: Note that this value specifically controls the number of retries.
trans-unit.target: Note that this value specifically controls the number of retries.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service will try the task once, and may then retry up to this limit.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service will try the task once, and may then retry up to this limit.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the maximum retry count is 3, Batch tries the task up to 4 times (one initial try and 3 retries).
trans-unit.target: For example, if the maximum retry count is 3, Batch tries the task up to 4 times (one initial try and 3 retries).

trans-unit.source: If the maximum retry count is 0, the Batch service does not retry the task.
trans-unit.target: If the maximum retry count is 0, the Batch service does not retry the task.

trans-unit.source: If the maximum retry count is -1, the Batch service retries the task without limit.
trans-unit.target: If the maximum retry count is -1, the Batch service retries the task without limit.

trans-unit.source: A string that uniquely identifies the Job Manager task within the job.
trans-unit.target: A string that uniquely identifies the Job Manager task within the job.

trans-unit.source: The id can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores and cannot contain more than 64 characters.
trans-unit.target: The id can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores and cannot contain more than 64 characters.

trans-unit.source: A display name for the Job Manager task.
trans-unit.target: A display name for the Job Manager task.

trans-unit.source: It need not be unique and can contain any Unicode characters up to a maximum length of 1024.
trans-unit.target: It need not be unique and can contain any Unicode characters up to a maximum length of 1024.

trans-unit.source: The command line of the Job Manager task.
trans-unit.target: The command line of the Job Manager task.

trans-unit.source: A list of files that Batch will download to the compute node before running the command line.
trans-unit.target: A list of files that Batch will download to the compute node before running the command line.

trans-unit.source: If you are providing the executable for the task, at least one instance of this element is required to specify the source location and target location of the executable file.
trans-unit.target: If you are providing the executable for the task, at least one instance of this element is required to specify the source location and target location of the executable file.

trans-unit.source: If the task requires additional supporting files, add additional instances of this element to list these files.
trans-unit.target: If the task requires additional supporting files, add additional instances of this element to list these files.

trans-unit.source: Files that listed under this element are located in the task’s <languageKeyword>wd</languageKeyword> directory.
trans-unit.target: Files that listed under this element are located in the task’s <languageKeyword>wd</languageKeyword> directory.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="6e4a5e67-dc09-4de2-8ae9-88a30987fcfb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List the files that are associated with a task</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="6e4a5e67-dc09-4de2-8ae9-88a30987fcfb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List the files that are associated with a task</link>.

trans-unit.source: If the command line is a default server program, and requires no additional supporting files, you do not need to include this element.
trans-unit.target: If the command line is a default server program, and requires no additional supporting files, you do not need to include this element.

trans-unit.source: A list of environment variable settings for the Job Manager task.
trans-unit.target: A list of environment variable settings for the Job Manager task.

trans-unit.source: Specifies constraints that apply to the Job Manager task.
trans-unit.target: Specifies constraints that apply to the Job Manager task.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether completion of the Job Manager task signifies completion of the entire job.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether completion of the Job Manager task signifies completion of the entire job.

trans-unit.source: If true, when the Job Manager task completes, the Batch service marks the job as complete.
trans-unit.target: If true, when the Job Manager task completes, the Batch service marks the job as complete.

trans-unit.source: If any tasks are still running at this time (other than Job Release), those tasks are terminated.
trans-unit.target: If any tasks are still running at this time (other than Job Release), those tasks are terminated.

trans-unit.source: If false, the completion of the Job Manager task does not affect the job status.
trans-unit.target: If false, the completion of the Job Manager task does not affect the job status.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the user needs to terminate the job explicitly.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the user needs to terminate the job explicitly.

trans-unit.source: An example of this is if the Job Manager creates a set of tasks but then takes no further role in their execution.
trans-unit.target: An example of this is if the Job Manager creates a set of tasks but then takes no further role in their execution.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether to run the Job Manager task in elevated mode.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether to run the Job Manager task in elevated mode.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the Job Manager task requires exclusive use of the compute node where it runs.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the Job Manager task requires exclusive use of the compute node where it runs.

trans-unit.source: If true, no other tasks will run on the same compute node for as long as the Job Manager is running.
trans-unit.target: If true, no other tasks will run on the same compute node for as long as the Job Manager is running.

trans-unit.source: If false, other tasks can run simultaneously with the Job Manager on a compute node.
trans-unit.target: If false, other tasks can run simultaneously with the Job Manager on a compute node.

trans-unit.source: (The Job Manager task counts normally against the node’s concurrent task limit, so this is only relevant if the node allows multiple concurrent tasks.)The default value is true.
trans-unit.target: (The Job Manager task counts normally against the node’s concurrent task limit, so this is only relevant if the node allows multiple concurrent tasks.)The default value is true.

trans-unit.source: A string that uniquely identifies the job preparation task within the job.
trans-unit.target: A string that uniquely identifies the job preparation task within the job.

trans-unit.source: The id can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores and cannot contain more than 64 characters.
trans-unit.target: The id can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores and cannot contain more than 64 characters.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify this property, the Batch service assigns a default value of “jobpreparation”.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify this property, the Batch service assigns a default value of “jobpreparation”.

trans-unit.source: No other task in the job can have the same id as the Job Preparation task.
trans-unit.target: No other task in the job can have the same id as the Job Preparation task.

trans-unit.source: If you try to submit a task with the same id, the Batch service rejects the request with HTTP status code 409 (Conflict) and error code TaskIdSameAsJobPreparationTask.
trans-unit.target: If you try to submit a task with the same id, the Batch service rejects the request with HTTP status code 409 (Conflict) and error code TaskIdSameAsJobPreparationTask.

trans-unit.source: The command line of the Job Preparation task.
trans-unit.target: The command line of the Job Preparation task.

trans-unit.source: A list of files that Batch will download to the compute node before running the command line.
trans-unit.target: A list of files that Batch will download to the compute node before running the command line.

trans-unit.source: If you are providing the executable for the task, at least one instance of this element is required to specify the source location and target location of the executable file.
trans-unit.target: If you are providing the executable for the task, at least one instance of this element is required to specify the source location and target location of the executable file.

trans-unit.source: If the task requires additional supporting files, add additional instances of this element to list these files.
trans-unit.target: If the task requires additional supporting files, add additional instances of this element to list these files.

trans-unit.source: Files that listed under this element are located in the task’s <languageKeyword>wd</languageKeyword> directory.
trans-unit.target: Files that listed under this element are located in the task’s <languageKeyword>wd</languageKeyword> directory.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="6e4a5e67-dc09-4de2-8ae9-88a30987fcfb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List the files that are associated with a task</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="6e4a5e67-dc09-4de2-8ae9-88a30987fcfb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List the files that are associated with a task</link>.

trans-unit.source: If the command line is a default server program, and requires no additional supporting files, you do not need to include this element.
trans-unit.target: If the command line is a default server program, and requires no additional supporting files, you do not need to include this element.

trans-unit.source: A list of environment variable settings for the Job Preparation task.
trans-unit.target: A list of environment variable settings for the Job Preparation task.

trans-unit.source: Specifies constraints that apply to the Job Preparation task.
trans-unit.target: Specifies constraints that apply to the Job Preparation task.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the Batch Service should wait for the Job Preparation task to complete successfully (that is, to exit with exit code 0) before scheduling any other tasks of the job on the compute node.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the Batch Service should wait for the Job Preparation task to complete successfully (that is, to exit with exit code 0) before scheduling any other tasks of the job on the compute node.

trans-unit.source: If true and the Job Preparation task fails on a compute node, the Batch service retries the Job Preparation task up to its maximum retry count (as specified in the constraints element).
trans-unit.target: If true and the Job Preparation task fails on a compute node, the Batch service retries the Job Preparation task up to its maximum retry count (as specified in the constraints element).

trans-unit.source: If the task has still not completed successfully after all retries, then the Batch service will not schedule tasks of the job to the compute node.
trans-unit.target: If the task has still not completed successfully after all retries, then the Batch service will not schedule tasks of the job to the compute node.

trans-unit.source: The compute node remains active and eligible to run tasks of other jobs.
trans-unit.target: The compute node remains active and eligible to run tasks of other jobs.

trans-unit.source: If false, the Batch service will not wait for the Job Preparation task to complete.
trans-unit.target: If false, the Batch service will not wait for the Job Preparation task to complete.

trans-unit.source: In this case, other tasks can start executing on the compute node while the Job Preparation task is still running; and even if the Job Preparation task fails, new tasks will continue to be scheduled on the node.
trans-unit.target: In this case, other tasks can start executing on the compute node while the Job Preparation task is still running; and even if the Job Preparation task fails, new tasks will continue to be scheduled on the node.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether to run the Job Preparation task in elevated mode.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether to run the Job Preparation task in elevated mode.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the Batch service should rerun the Job Preparation task after a compute node reboots.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the Batch service should rerun the Job Preparation task after a compute node reboots.

trans-unit.source: The Job Preparation task is <legacyItalic>always</legacyItalic> rerun if a compute node is reimaged, or if the Job Preparation task did not complete (e.g. because the reboot occurred while the task was running).
trans-unit.target: The Job Preparation task is <legacyItalic>always</legacyItalic> rerun if a compute node is reimaged, or if the Job Preparation task did not complete (e.g. because the reboot occurred while the task was running).

trans-unit.source: Therefore, you should always write a Job Preparation task to be idempotent and to behave correctly if run multiple times.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, you should always write a Job Preparation task to be idempotent and to behave correctly if run multiple times.

trans-unit.source: A string that uniquely identifies the Job Release task within the job.
trans-unit.target: A string that uniquely identifies the Job Release task within the job.

trans-unit.source: The id can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores and cannot contain more than 64 characters.
trans-unit.target: The id can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores and cannot contain more than 64 characters.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify this property, the Batch service assigns a default value of “jobrelease”.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify this property, the Batch service assigns a default value of “jobrelease”.

trans-unit.source: No other task in the job can have the same id as the Job Release task.
trans-unit.target: No other task in the job can have the same id as the Job Release task.

trans-unit.source: If you try to submit a task with the same id, the Batch service rejects the request with HTTP status code 409 (Conflict) and error code TaskIdSameAsJobReleaseTask.
trans-unit.target: If you try to submit a task with the same id, the Batch service rejects the request with HTTP status code 409 (Conflict) and error code TaskIdSameAsJobReleaseTask.

trans-unit.source: The command line of the Job Release task.
trans-unit.target: The command line of the Job Release task.

trans-unit.source: A list of files that Batch will download to the compute node before running the command line.
trans-unit.target: A list of files that Batch will download to the compute node before running the command line.

trans-unit.source: If you are providing the executable for the task, at least one instance of this element is required to specify the source location and target location of the executable file.
trans-unit.target: If you are providing the executable for the task, at least one instance of this element is required to specify the source location and target location of the executable file.

trans-unit.source: If the task requires additional supporting files, add additional instances of this element to list these files.
trans-unit.target: If the task requires additional supporting files, add additional instances of this element to list these files.

trans-unit.source: Files that listed under this element are located in the task’s <languageKeyword>wd</languageKeyword> directory.
trans-unit.target: Files that listed under this element are located in the task’s <languageKeyword>wd</languageKeyword> directory.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="6e4a5e67-dc09-4de2-8ae9-88a30987fcfb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List the files that are associated with a task</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="6e4a5e67-dc09-4de2-8ae9-88a30987fcfb" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List the files that are associated with a task</link>.

trans-unit.source: If the command line is a default server program, and requires no additional supporting files, you do not need to include this element.
trans-unit.target: If the command line is a default server program, and requires no additional supporting files, you do not need to include this element.

trans-unit.source: A list of environment variable settings for the Job Release task.
trans-unit.target: A list of environment variable settings for the Job Release task.

trans-unit.source: The maximum elapsed time that the Job Release task may run on a given compute node, measured from the time the task starts.
trans-unit.target: The maximum elapsed time that the Job Release task may run on a given compute node, measured from the time the task starts.

trans-unit.source: If the task does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it.
trans-unit.target: If the task does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it.

trans-unit.source: You may not specify a timeout longer than 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: You may not specify a timeout longer than 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: If you do, the Batch service rejects it with HTTP status code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: If you do, the Batch service rejects it with HTTP status code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: Specifies the minimum time to retain the working directory for the Job Release task on the compute node.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the minimum time to retain the working directory for the Job Release task on the compute node.

trans-unit.source: After this time, the Batch service may delete the working directory and all its contents.
trans-unit.target: After this time, the Batch service may delete the working directory and all its contents.

trans-unit.source: The default is infinite, i.e. the working directory will be retained until the compute node is removed or reimaged.
trans-unit.target: The default is infinite, i.e. the working directory will be retained until the compute node is removed or reimaged.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether to run the Job Release task in elevated mode.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether to run the Job Release task in elevated mode.

trans-unit.source: The URL of a blob in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: The URL of a blob in Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service downloads the blob to the specified file path.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service downloads the blob to the specified file path.

trans-unit.source: The URL must be readable using anonymous access; that is, the Batch service does not present any credentials when downloading the blob.
trans-unit.target: The URL must be readable using anonymous access; that is, the Batch service does not present any credentials when downloading the blob.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to get such a URL for a blob in Azure storage:
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to get such a URL for a blob in Azure storage:

trans-unit.source: Use a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting read permissions on the blob.
trans-unit.target: Use a Shared Access Signature (SAS) granting read permissions on the blob.

trans-unit.source: Set the ACL for the blob’s container to allow public access.
trans-unit.target: Set the ACL for the blob’s container to allow public access.

trans-unit.source: The location on the compute node to which the file should be downloaded.
trans-unit.target: The location on the compute node to which the file should be downloaded.

trans-unit.source: The name of the environment variable.
trans-unit.target: The name of the environment variable.

trans-unit.source: The value of the environment variable.
trans-unit.target: The value of the environment variable.

trans-unit.source: The maximum elapsed time that the task may run, measured from the time the task starts.
trans-unit.target: The maximum elapsed time that the task may run, measured from the time the task starts.

trans-unit.source: If the task does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it.
trans-unit.target: If the task does not complete within the time limit, the Batch service terminates it.

trans-unit.source: If this is not specified, there is no time limit on how long the task may run.
trans-unit.target: If this is not specified, there is no time limit on how long the task may run.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of times the task may be retried.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of times the task may be retried.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service retries a task if its exit code is nonzero.

trans-unit.source: Note that this value specifically controls the number of <legacyItalic>retries</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: Note that this value specifically controls the number of <legacyItalic>retries</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service will <legacyItalic>try</legacyItalic> the task once, and may then <legacyItalic>retry</legacyItalic> up to this limit.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service will <legacyItalic>try</legacyItalic> the task once, and may then <legacyItalic>retry</legacyItalic> up to this limit.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the maximum retry count is 3, Batch tries the task up to 4 times (one initial try and 3 retries).
trans-unit.target: For example, if the maximum retry count is 3, Batch tries the task up to 4 times (one initial try and 3 retries).

trans-unit.source: If the maximum retry count is 0, the Batch service does not retry the task.
trans-unit.target: If the maximum retry count is 0, the Batch service does not retry the task.

trans-unit.source: If the maximum retry count is -1, the Batch service retries the task without limit.
trans-unit.target: If the maximum retry count is -1, the Batch service retries the task without limit.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the minimum time to retain the working directory for the task on the compute node where it ran.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the minimum time to retain the working directory for the task on the compute node where it ran.

trans-unit.source: After this time, the Batch service may delete the working directory and all its contents.
trans-unit.target: After this time, the Batch service may delete the working directory and all its contents.

trans-unit.source: The default is infinite, i.e. the working directory will be retained until the compute node is removed or reimaged.
trans-unit.target: The default is infinite, i.e. the working directory will be retained until the compute node is removed or reimaged.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the id of an existing pool.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the id of an existing pool.

trans-unit.source: All the tasks of the job will run on the specified pool.
trans-unit.target: All the tasks of the job will run on the specified pool.

trans-unit.source: To find the ids of existing pools, see <link xlink:href="f37e3f20-f5ac-49e1-a026-586086a566b4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List the pools in an account</link>.
trans-unit.target: To find the ids of existing pools, see <link xlink:href="f37e3f20-f5ac-49e1-a026-586086a566b4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List the pools in an account</link>.

trans-unit.source: You must specify <legacyItalic>either</legacyItalic> poolId <legacyItalic>or</legacyItalic> autoPoolSpecification, but not both.
trans-unit.target: You must specify <legacyItalic>either</legacyItalic> poolId <legacyItalic>or</legacyItalic> autoPoolSpecification, but not both.

trans-unit.source: Specifies characteristics for a temporary ‘auto pool.’
trans-unit.target: Specifies characteristics for a temporary ‘auto pool.’

trans-unit.source: The Batch service will create this auto pool and run all the tasks of the job will run on it, and will delete the pool once the job has completed.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service will create this auto pool and run all the tasks of the job will run on it, and will delete the pool once the job has completed.

trans-unit.source: You must specify <legacyItalic>either</legacyItalic> poolId <legacyItalic>or</legacyItalic> autoPoolSpecification, but not both.
trans-unit.target: You must specify <legacyItalic>either</legacyItalic> poolId <legacyItalic>or</legacyItalic> autoPoolSpecification, but not both.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service assigns each auto pool a unique identifier on creation.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service assigns each auto pool a unique identifier on creation.

trans-unit.source: To distinguish between pools created for different purposes, you can specify this element to add a prefix to the id that is assigned.
trans-unit.target: To distinguish between pools created for different purposes, you can specify this element to add a prefix to the id that is assigned.

trans-unit.source: The prefix can be up to 20 characters long.
trans-unit.target: The prefix can be up to 20 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the minimum lifetime of created auto pools, and how multiple jobs on a schedule are assigned to pools.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the minimum lifetime of created auto pools, and how multiple jobs on a schedule are assigned to pools.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>job</languageKeyword>: the pool exists for the lifetime of the job to which it is dedicated.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>job</languageKeyword>: the pool exists for the lifetime of the job to which it is dedicated.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service creates the pool when it creates the job.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service creates the pool when it creates the job.

trans-unit.source: If applied to a job schedule, the Batch service creates a new auto pool for every job created on the schedule.
trans-unit.target: If applied to a job schedule, the Batch service creates a new auto pool for every job created on the schedule.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>jobschedule</languageKeyword> – the pool exists for the lifetime of the job schedule.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>jobschedule</languageKeyword> – the pool exists for the lifetime of the job schedule.

trans-unit.source: The Batch Service creates the pool when it creates the first job on the schedule.
trans-unit.target: The Batch Service creates the pool when it creates the first job on the schedule.

trans-unit.source: You may apply this option only to job schedules, not to jobs.
trans-unit.target: You may apply this option only to job schedules, not to jobs.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether to keep an auto pool alive after its lifetime expires.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether to keep an auto pool alive after its lifetime expires.

trans-unit.source: If false, the Batch service deletes the pool once its lifetime (as determined by the poolLifetimeOption setting) expires; that is, when the job or job schedule completes.
trans-unit.target: If false, the Batch service deletes the pool once its lifetime (as determined by the poolLifetimeOption setting) expires; that is, when the job or job schedule completes.

trans-unit.source: If true, the Batch service does not delete the pool automatically.
trans-unit.target: If true, the Batch service does not delete the pool automatically.

trans-unit.source: It is up to the user to delete auto pools created with this option.
trans-unit.target: It is up to the user to delete auto pools created with this option.

trans-unit.source: Contains the pool specification for the auto pool.
trans-unit.target: Contains the pool specification for the auto pool.

trans-unit.source: Display name for the auto pool.
trans-unit.target: Display name for the auto pool.

trans-unit.source: It need not be unique and can contain any Unicode characters up to a maximum length of 1024.
trans-unit.target: It need not be unique and can contain any Unicode characters up to a maximum length of 1024.

trans-unit.source: The size of virtual machines in the pool.
trans-unit.target: The size of virtual machines in the pool.

trans-unit.source: All VMs in a pool are the same size.
trans-unit.target: All VMs in a pool are the same size.

trans-unit.source: For information about available sizes of virtual machines, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn197896.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> .
trans-unit.target: For information about available sizes of virtual machines, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn197896.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> .

trans-unit.source: Batch supports all Azure VM sizes except ExtraSmall.
trans-unit.target: Batch supports all Azure VM sizes except ExtraSmall.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Guest OS family to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Guest OS family to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>2</languageKeyword> – OS Family 2, equivalent to Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>2</languageKeyword> – OS Family 2, equivalent to Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>3</languageKeyword> – OS Family 3, equivalent to Windows Server 2012
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>3</languageKeyword> – OS Family 3, equivalent to Windows Server 2012

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>4</languageKeyword> – OS Family 4, equivalent to Windows Server 2012 R2
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>4</languageKeyword> – OS Family 4, equivalent to Windows Server 2012 R2

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix/#releases</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix/#releases</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Guest OS version to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Guest OS version to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool.

trans-unit.source: The default value is * which specifies the latest operating system version for the specified family.
trans-unit.target: The default value is * which specifies the latest operating system version for the specified family.

trans-unit.source: For other permitted values, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix/#releases</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: For other permitted values, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Guest OS Releases</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/cloud-services-guestos-update-matrix/#releases</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: Specifies the timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool.

trans-unit.source: This timeout applies only to manual scaling; it has no effect when enableAutoScale is set to true.
trans-unit.target: This timeout applies only to manual scaling; it has no effect when enableAutoScale is set to true.

trans-unit.source: If you specify a value less than 5 minutes, the Batch service returns a Bad Request (400).
trans-unit.target: If you specify a value less than 5 minutes, the Batch service returns a Bad Request (400).

trans-unit.source: Specifies the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

trans-unit.source: This setting has no effect if enableAutoScale is set to true.
trans-unit.target: This setting has no effect if enableAutoScale is set to true.

trans-unit.source: It is required if enableAutoScale is set to false.
trans-unit.target: It is required if enableAutoScale is set to false.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.

trans-unit.source: The maximum value of this setting depends on the size of the compute nodes in the pool (the vmSize setting).
trans-unit.target: The maximum value of this setting depends on the size of the compute nodes in the pool (the vmSize setting).

trans-unit.source: Defines how the Batch service distributes tasks between compute nodes in the pool.
trans-unit.target: Defines how the Batch service distributes tasks between compute nodes in the pool.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

trans-unit.source: This element is required if enableAutoScale is set to true.
trans-unit.target: This element is required if enableAutoScale is set to true.

trans-unit.source: The formula is checked for validity before the pool is created.
trans-unit.target: The formula is checked for validity before the pool is created.

trans-unit.source: If the formula is not valid, the Batch service rejects the request with detailed error information.
trans-unit.target: If the formula is not valid, the Batch service rejects the request with detailed error information.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the pool size should automatically adjust over time.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the pool size should automatically adjust over time.

trans-unit.source: If false, the targetDedicated element is required.
trans-unit.target: If false, the targetDedicated element is required.

trans-unit.source: If true, the autoScaleFormula element is required.
trans-unit.target: If true, the autoScaleFormula element is required.

trans-unit.source: The pool automatically resizes according to the formula.
trans-unit.target: The pool automatically resizes according to the formula.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the pool permits direct communication between nodes.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the pool permits direct communication between nodes.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a task to run on each compute node as it joins the pool.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a task to run on each compute node as it joins the pool.

trans-unit.source: The task runs when the node is added to the pool or when the node is restarted.
trans-unit.target: The task runs when the node is added to the pool or when the node is restarted.

trans-unit.source: A list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.
trans-unit.target: A list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

trans-unit.source: Each certificate in the list must have been previously added to the Batch account.
trans-unit.target: Each certificate in the list must have been previously added to the Batch account.

trans-unit.source: A list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.
trans-unit.target: A list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.

trans-unit.source: The Batch service does not assign any meaning to metadata; it is solely for the use of user code.
trans-unit.target: The Batch service does not assign any meaning to metadata; it is solely for the use of user code.

trans-unit.source: The start time of the job.
trans-unit.target: The start time of the job.

trans-unit.source: The job ‘starts’ when the first task starts running on any compute node.
trans-unit.target: The job ‘starts’ when the first task starts running on any compute node.

trans-unit.source: (This includes Job Manager and Job Preparation tasks.)
trans-unit.target: (This includes Job Manager and Job Preparation tasks.)

trans-unit.source: The completion time of the job.
trans-unit.target: The completion time of the job.

trans-unit.source: This property is present only if the job is in the <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.
trans-unit.target: This property is present only if the job is in the <languageKeyword>completed</languageKeyword> state.

trans-unit.source: The id of the pool to which this job is assigned.
trans-unit.target: The id of the pool to which this job is assigned.

trans-unit.source: This depends on the <legacyItalic>poolInfo</legacyItalic> you specified when creating or updating the job.
trans-unit.target: This depends on the <legacyItalic>poolInfo</legacyItalic> you specified when creating or updating the job.

trans-unit.source: If you specified a <legacyItalic>poolId</legacyItalic>, this is that poolId..
trans-unit.target: If you specified a <legacyItalic>poolId</legacyItalic>, this is that poolId..

trans-unit.source: If you specified an <legacyItalic>autoPoolSpecification</legacyItalic>, this is the id of the auto pool that Batch created for this job.
trans-unit.target: If you specified an <legacyItalic>autoPoolSpecification</legacyItalic>, this is the id of the auto pool that Batch created for this job.

trans-unit.source: (Note: this element contains the <legacyItalic>actual</legacyItalic> pool where the job is assigned.
trans-unit.target: (Note: this element contains the <legacyItalic>actual</legacyItalic> pool where the job is assigned.

trans-unit.source: The Get Job response also contains a poolInfo element, which contains the pool configuration data from Add/Update Job.
trans-unit.target: The Get Job response also contains a poolInfo element, which contains the pool configuration data from Add/Update Job.

trans-unit.source: This may also contain a poolId element.
trans-unit.target: This may also contain a poolId element.

trans-unit.source: If it does, the two ids are the same.
trans-unit.target: If it does, the two ids are the same.

trans-unit.source: If it does not, it means the job ran on an auto pool, and this element contains the id of that auto pool.)
trans-unit.target: If it does not, it means the job ran on an auto pool, and this element contains the id of that auto pool.)

trans-unit.source: If there was an error starting the job, this element contains the error details.
trans-unit.target: If there was an error starting the job, this element contains the error details.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, this element is not present.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, this element is not present.

trans-unit.source: If the job has completed, a string describing the reason the job ended.
trans-unit.target: If the job has completed, a string describing the reason the job ended.

trans-unit.source: The Batch Service sets the reason as following:
trans-unit.target: The Batch Service sets the reason as following:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>JMComplete</languageKeyword> – the Job Manager task completed, and killJobOnCompletion was set to true
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>JMComplete</languageKeyword> – the Job Manager task completed, and killJobOnCompletion was set to true

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>TerminateJobSchedule</languageKeyword> – the job ran as part of a schedule, and the schedule terminated
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>TerminateJobSchedule</languageKeyword> – the job ran as part of a schedule, and the schedule terminated

trans-unit.source: Any other string is a user-defined reason specified in a call to the Terminate a job operation.
trans-unit.target: Any other string is a user-defined reason specified in a call to the Terminate a job operation.

trans-unit.source: If the job has not completed, this element is not present.
trans-unit.target: If the job has not completed, this element is not present.

trans-unit.source: The category of the job scheduling error.
trans-unit.target: The category of the job scheduling error.

trans-unit.source: An identifier for the job scheduling error.
trans-unit.target: An identifier for the job scheduling error.

trans-unit.source: Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.
trans-unit.target: Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

trans-unit.source: A message describing the job scheduling error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.
trans-unit.target: A message describing the job scheduling error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

trans-unit.source: A list of additional error details related to the scheduling error.
trans-unit.target: A list of additional error details related to the scheduling error.

trans-unit.source: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.
trans-unit.target: The start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

trans-unit.source: The time at which the statistics were last updated.
trans-unit.target: The time at which the statistics were last updated.

trans-unit.source: All statistics are limited to the range between startTime and lastUpdateTime.
trans-unit.target: All statistics are limited to the range between startTime and lastUpdateTime.

trans-unit.source: The total user mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by all the tasks in the job.
trans-unit.target: The total user mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by all the tasks in the job.

trans-unit.source: The total kernel mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by all the tasks in the job.
trans-unit.target: The total kernel mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by all the tasks in the job.

trans-unit.source: The total wall clock time of all the tasks in the job.
trans-unit.target: The total wall clock time of all the tasks in the job.

trans-unit.source: The wall clock time is the elapsed time from when the task started running on a compute node to when it finished (or to the last time the statistics were updated, if the task had not finished by then).
trans-unit.target: The wall clock time is the elapsed time from when the task started running on a compute node to when it finished (or to the last time the statistics were updated, if the task had not finished by then).

trans-unit.source: If a task was retried, this includes the wall clock time of all the task retries.
trans-unit.target: If a task was retried, this includes the wall clock time of all the task retries.

trans-unit.source: The total number of I/O read operations performed by all the tasks in the job
trans-unit.target: The total number of I/O read operations performed by all the tasks in the job

trans-unit.source: The total number of I/O write operations performed by all the tasks in the job.
trans-unit.target: The total number of I/O write operations performed by all the tasks in the job.

trans-unit.source: The total amount of data (in GiB) of I/O read by all the tasks in the job.
trans-unit.target: The total amount of data (in GiB) of I/O read by all the tasks in the job.

trans-unit.source: The total amount of data (in GiB) of I/O written by all the tasks in the job.
trans-unit.target: The total amount of data (in GiB) of I/O written by all the tasks in the job.

trans-unit.source: The total number of tasks successfully completed in the job during the given time range.
trans-unit.target: The total number of tasks successfully completed in the job during the given time range.

trans-unit.source: A task completes successfully if it returns exit code 0.
trans-unit.target: A task completes successfully if it returns exit code 0.

trans-unit.source: The total number of tasks in the job that failed during the given time range.
trans-unit.target: The total number of tasks in the job that failed during the given time range.

trans-unit.source: A task fails if it exhausts its maximum retry count without returning exit code 0.
trans-unit.target: A task fails if it exhausts its maximum retry count without returning exit code 0.

trans-unit.source: The total number of retries on all the tasks in the job during the given time range.
trans-unit.target: The total number of retries on all the tasks in the job during the given time range.

trans-unit.source: The total wait time of all the tasks in the job.
trans-unit.target: The total wait time of all the tasks in the job.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyItalic>wait time</legacyItalic> for a task is defined as the elapsed time between the creation of the task creation and the start of task execution.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyItalic>wait time</legacyItalic> for a task is defined as the elapsed time between the creation of the task creation and the start of task execution.

trans-unit.source: (If the task is retried due to failures, the wait time is the time to the <legacyItalic>most recent</legacyItalic> task execution.)
trans-unit.target: (If the task is retried due to failures, the wait time is the time to the <legacyItalic>most recent</legacyItalic> task execution.)

trans-unit.source: This value is only reported in the account lifetime statistics; it is not included in the job statistics.
trans-unit.target: This value is only reported in the account lifetime statistics; it is not included in the job statistics.
